attributes.additional_details:
The UK government must strongly condemn the recent shooting of innocent civilian protestors in Sudan between 23-30 September 2013.
Responsible department: Foreign and Commonwealth Office


The reports and videos showing brutal shooting of innocent Sudanese protestors by security forces and government militia are truly disturbing. Such shooting on this scale must be condemned by the British government.

Such shooting of innocent protesting civilian would be the worst in recent history of Sudan and those that committed it and their sponsors must face the full weight of justice
